alert.note: Alert for Clarke; Jasper; Jones; Lauderdale; Newton; Scott (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 10 at 6:37PM CDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Jasper, Newton, southern Kemper, Clarke, eastern Scott, eastern Jones and Lauderdale Counties through 730 PM CDT... At 637 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Hickory to near Ovett. Movement was northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Hickory around 640 PM CDT. Chunky around 645 PM CDT. Meehan around 650 PM CDT. Duffee around 655 PM CDT. Meridian, Collinsville, Nellieburg and Suqualena around 700 PM CDT. Martin around 705 PM CDT. Marion around 710 PM CDT. Prismatic around 715 PM CDT. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM CDT for central, southeastern and east central Mississippi.

area.areaDesc: Clarke; Jasper; Jones; Lauderdale; Newton; Scott
